Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with leaves and stems standing up when it has enough water.
The student can draw a plant with droopy leaves and stems when it does not have enough water.
The student can draw a plant that is growing well in the sunlight.
The student can draw a plant that is not growing or has yellow leaves when kept in the dark.
The student can use their drawing to show that plants need water and light to live and grow.
